subject: RE: [junit] Continuous Hours of Stress/Operation Test
msgSnippet: http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit/ This will distribute JUnit tests across threads, VMs, and processors (machines). There s also a prerelease of
messageBody:
http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit/

This will distribute JUnit tests across threads, VMs, and processors
(machines). There's also a prerelease of newer code that's not linked
that adds a few more features such as configurable thread launch delays
and file-based load profiles. Let me know if you're interested in that.

- Mike

------------------
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
www.javatesting.com
The Object Testing Company
> -----Original Message-----
> From: neti0 <neti0@...> [mailto:neti0@...]
> Sent: Thursday, December 19, 2002 9:00 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Continuous Hours of Stress/Operation Test
>
>
> Is there a class (extension or otherwise) that not only repeats
> defined number of times (like RepeatedTest) but also can test for
> simultaneous hits (may be by starting multiple threads of the
> repeated tests). This will help to simulate Continuous Hours of
> Stress/Operation for a Server Component.
>
> Say there is a component that is accessed "24 X 7" by "N" number of
> simultaneous users/clients on the Internet/Intranet. RepeatedTest
> allows one to simulate the "24 X 7" portion. How about if one needs
> to also simulate the number "N" of simultaneous users/clients?
>
>
>
